name: Fruits of Labor, Inc.
address: Multiple locations including Rainelle, Spring Dale, Alderson, and Montgomery, WV
description: Offers a Farm-to-Table Agricultural training program for adults recovering from substance use disorder and prevention programs for youth. The program is American Culinary Federation certified and covers the complete cycle of food production
services: American-Indian-owned Culinary training in West-Virginia consultation

name: Blue Ridge Community and Technical College
description: Offers a one-year certificate program in Culinary Arts, focusing on foundational knowledge and hands-on training for entry-level positions in the food service, hospitality, and tourism industry
services: American-Indian-owned Culinary training in West-Virginia consultation

name: West Virginia Northern Community College
description: Offers an Associate Degree in Culinary Arts, covering culinary fundamentals, baking, and hospitality management, with opportunities for real-world experience through externships
services: American-Indian-owned Culinary training in West-Virginia consultation

name: Pierpont Community & Technical College
description: Provides an Associate Degree in Culinary Arts with training in classical and modern cooking techniques, baking, and restaurant operations, including internships
services: American-Indian-owned Culinary training in West-Virginia consultation

name: West Virginia University – Hospitality and Tourism Management Program
description: Offers a Bachelor's Degree in Hospitality and Tourism Management, focusing on food service management, hotel operations, and event planning
services: American-Indian-owned Culinary training in West-Virginia consultation

name: My Kitchen
description: A licensed commercial kitchen offering demonstrations and hands-on cooking classes for home cooks, taught by Chef Chris Hall
services: American-Indian-owned Culinary training in West-Virginia consultation

name: Huntington's Kitchen
description: A community-focused culinary center offering a variety of classes for all skill levels, with a goal to change how the community views and interacts with food. Head Chef Isabel Cross has extensive culinary training
services: American-Indian-owned Culinary training in West-Virginia consultation

name: The Greenbrier
address: 101 Main Street West, White Sulphur Springs, WV 24986
description: Offers "Cooking Class with Greenbrier Favorites," a demonstration class where participants learn to prepare dishes from one of their award-winning chefs
services: American-Indian-owned Culinary training in West-Virginia consultation

name: Augusta Heritage Center
description: Offers a series of foodways classes taught by experienced chefs and home cooks, covering various dishes and culinary traditions
services: American-Indian-owned Culinary training in West-Virginia consultation

name: West Virginia Health Right (Prepped to Serve Appalachia Program)
description: Offers an accelerated food service certification program designed to train West Virginians for front-of-house and food prep positions, with training from James Beard Award winner Chef Paul Smith. This program is open to individuals on a journey of recovery and those with household incomes at or below 250% of the Federal Poverty Level
